ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: What is the research participant's HIV status as determined from diagnostic biomarkers for HIV infection?
Notes: 1= HIV Exposed; status indeterminate (for children/adolescents only); 2= HIV exposed, uninfected (for children/adolescentas only); 3= Negative; 4= Positive; 5= Indeterminant; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What year was the research participant first diagnosed with HIV?
Notes: YYYY. Any year from 1980 to present will be permitted. Investigators will report data if HIV status is positive.

ElementDescription: Has the research participant ever used antiretroviral therapy (ART)?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Yes, but not currently; 2= Yes, currently; 8= Not applicable; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What measure was used to determine antiretroviral therapy use by the research participant?
Notes: 1= Biomarker of ART use (e.g., hair antiretroviral concentrations); 2= Objective measure (e.g., medical monitoring, pharmacy refills); 9= Unknown. Investigators will report if HIV status is positive.

ElementDescription: What year did the research participant first use antiretroviral therapy?
Notes: YYYY. Any year from 1987 to present will be permitted. Investigators will report data if participant uses ART.

ElementDescription: Has the research participant ever used Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP)?
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Yes, but not currently; 2= Yes, currently; 8= Not Applicable; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What measure was used to determine Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) use by the research participant?
Notes: 1= Biomarker of PrEP use (e.g., hair antiretroviral concentrations); 2= Objective measure (e.g., medical monitoring, pharmacy refills); 9= Unknown. Investigators will report data if HIV status is negative or unknown.

ElementDescription: What year did the research participant first use Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP)?
Notes: YYYY. Any year from 2012 to present will be permitted. Investigators will  report data only if participants have used PrEP.
